A hacker encrypted the vault code, but reused a blum integer modulus, making their RSA vulnerable. The intercepted ciphertext is: 3387408129270630501418057116438495645290429210487412955727505148729841381754361776958826891662404450529462546800660498856518742601838468901395625639399144

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8516843934627172102792558741226743483708016630011353364557428624923898827833670210687218026973197919518039880089023569154616278894520647956395489327544313, e=6126624513637921342182341097903976008944588233616377782844129225395602361743933973420914133905317132606139347929989702370473160518767676245945811186132267
The lower 104 bits of p are: 84346009056300977023226377311380380507


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{zzi6s37f}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3387408129270630501418057116438495645290429210487412955727505148729841381754361776958826891662404450529462546800660498856518742601838468901395625639399144
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8516843934627172102792558741226743483708016630011353364557428624923898827833670210687218026973197919518039880089023569154616278894520647956395489327544313, e=6126624513637921342182341097903976008944588233616377782844129225395602361743933973420914133905317132606139347929989702370473160518767676245945811186132267
The lower 104 bits of p are: 84346009056300977023226377311380380507

extra_info: p=96279867744142272633787348186239419597246014527034592260731305591490801376091, q=88459240069379324777285402622023088159853179758720969903952704004961945296443, Ï†(n)=8516843934627172102792558741226743483708016630011353364557428624923898827833485471579404505375786846767231617581266469960330523332355963946799036580871780
